text: Lillian Evelyn Moller Gilbreth (May 24, 1878 â€“ January 2, 1972) was an American psychologist, industrial engineer, consultant, and educator. She was known for her works with psychology to time-and-motion studies. She was called "a genius in the art of living." Gilbreth, one of the first female engineers to earn a Ph.D.. She and her husband, Frank Bunker Gilbreth, were experts who work to the study of industrial engineering. ==References== Category:1878 births Category:1972 deaths Category:American psychologists Category:Engineers from California Category:Educators from Oakland, California Category:Writers from Oakland, California Category:Scientists from Oakland, California Category:American industrial engineers
title: Lillian Moller Gilbreth
